example.name: all args
example.text: Courts have ruled that taxpayers must submit to TCMP audits, but the IRS will excuse from the fullscale rigors anyone who was audited without change for either 1986 or 1987.
example.arg: anyone who was audited without change for either 1986 or 1987

example.name: missing excused

example.name: missing agent
example.text: In other earthquake-related news, [Hambrecht& Quist's OTC market makers]-1 were excused *trace*-1 from trading yesterday and its positions were frozen for the day by the National Association of Securities Dealers.

example.name: social construct
example.text: "*trace* Excuse me," John said after emitting a thunderclap-like belch at the dinner table.

roleset.name: explanation offered to obtain foregiveness, justify
roleset.note: EXCUSE-N NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT p01, part 4. This is etymologically, but no longer syntactically related to the verb excuse.01. WordSketch provides no indication that "excuse" is ever used in the sense expressed by verb excuse: to relieve from responsibility, etc. (from excuse.01-n)
